intro: Breweria pickeringii var. cuthbertii, commonly known as the Cuthbert's breweria, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, leaf-like structures that store water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
